fields.description: Allow creation of a stack from an existing or uploaded template.

comments.body: Note to self: Need to add acceptance criteria for the tag editor if we opt to keep it in the Create Stack wizard, pending confirmation from [~jloza] based on the comments in https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+stack
[~kgill], we do support creating tags at time of stack creation, so we're keeping tag editor there. Tags will be non-editable on the stack detail page. Wireframes have beeen updated. Thanks!
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1312
[~dkavanagh] if this is ready for review it should go to me for UX review before code review please.
Ah, right. I was sending to Kamal while you were away and forgot.

Following up on comments in on the wireframe. I've attached a screenshot showing how the AWS console creates a bucket for templates on behalf of the user. They prefix with "cf-templates", then use some alphanumeric string followed by the zone suffix. We could do that with the account ID, which should be sufficient. [~decker]?
+1 [~dkavanagh] :)

Nice job!

General tab:
* name label should be label class, no colon (fixed)
* Next button is enabled even though I have not supplied a name, which is a required field, I was also able to move to the next tab without providing a name. Validation problem there. (not seeing in FF)

Template section:
* needs more whitespace between section title and first radio button (match General section above it)
* radio button labels missing bubble help (done)
* widgets should be indented under radio buttons (done)
* uploading template file causes an empty red error box to display at the top (fie is JSON template that works on AWS). See attached screenshot. Also, should not be allowed to choose anything else while error message is displayed (may be a global problem) (yes, global, never meant for those to be modal, if so, let's put front and center)

Parameters tab:
* Can we use some ninja skills to indicate the definitions of the VM types here like we do in the launch instance wizard? (ninja called, job done)
* Key widget not populating as dropdown with known key names (does for me, did you have keypairs defined?)
* Create stack button should be title case (done)
* Bottom section has too much padding below it, should be consistently at the bottom of the screen and the whitespace should be in content area instead (true on both tabs, probably a foundation/CSS thing)) (fixed)

Summary area:
* Parameters not populating in summary area when selected (done)
* Tags not included in summary area (done)
* labels should not have colons, (I notice colons are there in other wizards, so universal change?

Stack did not create and I got waitress error. 

TBD: sample template review
Jenny, lots if not all the things fixed here. Pls review on GUI-1488 branch.

sample template discussion:
 - deliver initial set as static assets in package
 - allow for additions (not deletions) via S3.
 - configured bucket in the console.ini
 - handle errors and no bucket configured.

Good progress!

General tab:
* too much padding between name label and associated text entry field.  (done)
* something is up with the alignment that is screwing up the help icons, maybe we should replace these help bubbles with the help icon from font awesome to avoid this in future. I'll open a separate ticket for that
* sample template selection box down arrow is either tiny or hidden (need to use chosen, but it broke some thing when I tried before. It will look better once I get that done)
* I am so sorry, but I am changing my tune on the template area help bubbles. I don't think we really need them, they are fairly self-explanatory. Sorry! Please remove. (done)
* selecting a sample template gave me an "invalid access key or token" error that appears in a toast, what is this? Then the next button lets me proceed but I just get a loading indicator forever, no params populate (toast? I wonder if your session timed out and we didn't notify?)
* parameters page: i selected a json template and the parms page populated with the parms, all had an assigned default but the create stack button is still disabled. I should be able to create stack now. Looking back, I had left the name field on the previous screen blank, even though it's required, and that next button is enabled when it shouldn't be. Still seeing this issue in chrome. (fixed validation on step1)
* whitespace issue in template section still there
* still not seeing vmtypes defined on parms page
* button bar stil has too much padding
* too much padding in summary section above name (match other sections in summary area please for top padding  (same problem on launch wiz summary, will look for general fix) (done)
* i uploaded a template, but when i went back to the first page the url radio button was selected, with no url populated. and now the next button is disabled. (tried in chrome and FF and did not see it)

Let's screen share and i can show you these things. Please put something on my calendar to walk through UX issues.
[~dkavanagh]: I've merged https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1312 and have left the GUI-1488 branch open since I'm not sure if there's more work to do there.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1331

* sample template selection appears to still not be using chosen
* changed sample template selection a couple of times and got error message again in toast: "The request signature we calculated does not match the signature you provided."
* parameters page not using font awesome icons (is that fixed in another branch? Let me know)
* summary section: parm labels should stack on top of parm values please

Looking good otherwise!

PR 1331 (on branch GUI-1489) sets chosen widget for sample template
FA change is on GUI-1636 branch, no PR for that yet.
will update params in summary.
not sure on that 2nd bullet.. need to investigate.

to confirm, FA changes in another branch (send that PR to you for review today).
I think the only other change pending (not in master) is fixed in the GUI-1489 branch PR.
Not sure if you want to review those separately, but passing this along anyway.

* sample template widget no longer indented under radio button properly
* "select a template" should not be a selectable option in chosen widget. It shouldn't even be in the option list when the widget opens. 
* when i select a sample template the working icon displays int eh summary area under the listed template, even though the template already is displayed int eh summary area. what is the working icon there for?
* description in summary pane doesn't update when i change sample template selection.
* I have a name and a sample template selected but next button is grayed out. Screenshot attached. Stopping review now and kicking ticket back. Please slow down and check work before resubmitting. (using chrome)

Fixed the 1st 2 issues.
The working icon shows (as you asked for) because I'm loading the template and getting the description from it (for the summary). I'm also pulling the params for step 2, but the working icon was for the description which populates in summary.
If you didn't see the description change, it was because the samples we have don't have different descriptions. Now, perhaps we should remove the description and use the working icon to make that more obvious... will do that.
The next button would be grey'ed out if you select a template, then enter a name, but don't change focus since validation happens then. If the user follows the normal order, they won't notice this since focus is changed when a template is selected.
GUI-1489 contains the fixes, more 1 stop shopping!

The working icon shows **in the wrong place**...if it is working to load the description that is where the icon should be. 

You may need to add something to make the button enable without changing focus. Once all required fields have data the button should be enabled regardless of the order in which they are selected.

I don't think it's in the wrong place. It's exactly where the "description" will appear once loaded. If you select a different template, it looks the same (see screen-shot). If you'd like it someplace else, please let me know where.

I can add a listener for the name field to handle enablement and validation.
Unless you moved it since I wrote the previous comment, it's in the wrong place. I will check when I review this ticket later.
no, the screen show shows where it's been for, well, some time..  Does the screenshot look right? That's also how I see it in Chrome.

It should be below the Description label, if it is loading the description. The screenshot doesn't show the description label. Try loading one template and then changing to another. Then you'll see the indicator is above the associated label, rather than underneath.
Ok, I can change it up. I don't show the description label if there isn't a description. I'll adjust.
hi [~dkavanagh] is the description thing fixed, and this is ready for review? If so what branch should I be reviewing it on?
yes, it's fixed. Still the GUI-1489 branch.

* name validation eror message does not contain good grammar. Please update last part to "should not be longer than..." (done)
* summary area contains subsection divider line (light gray one) even though it is completely unpopulated. see screenshot) (done)
* sample template selector watermark text does not match wireframe in content or case (dang, right in code, but chosen didn't pick it up, fixed)
* unable to change selected sample template once I've selected one. Summary area template name changes, but not description and not the selection widget itself. Did you try this? Screenshot attached showing where it's stuck (I selected deploy one first, then tried to switch to LAMP, you can see LAMP in summary, but not in selection widget or summary description) (The templates are the same, just named differently for now. I changed the LAMP template description so you can see that this actually works)
* parms tab: watermark text in chosen boxes is not sentence case (fixed)
* review comment from 3/24 about summary section label/values stacking not addressed (done)
all changes pushed to GUI-1489 branch

I believe this has finally passed UX review! Any small problems I see later I will file separate bugs for. Nice job!

Passing on for code review.
[~dkavanagh] I think this ticket was perhaps marked fixed accidentally? It needs to go to In QA first.
already passed code review according to [~dkavanagh] as part of GUI-1489 branch, moving to correct state in Jira

[~dkavanagh]: I currently do not see any sample stack templates.  Should there be some by default?
[~ccassler], yes, but it's possible the package script is failing to include those, or that the path we're examining is incorrect. Could I inspect your system?
[~dkavanagh]: Sure you can check 10.111.1.135 or the shared setup 10.111.5.1.  Both systems are showing this behavior.
[~dkavanagh]: I created GUI-1808 on this issue.
Released in 4.2
